website_summaries.verdict: Amazon's update to their mid-range Kindle makes it a must-have for anyone needing a casual e-reader.
pros: It's available with either 8GB or 32GB of storage
The 300 ppi screen is gorgeous, and the battery lasts for weeks
It's waterproof, and you can add a wireless LTE plan if you need one
cons: Lacks automatic light-sensing found on pricier models
Default setup includes ads, with small fee for removal

customer_reviews.title: Lacks a sleep timer...
customer_reviews.text: Love the new paperwhite, decided to upgrade from my original paperwhite mostly for the ability to listen to audio books on it. My reason for 4 star reviews is unfortunately it lacks a sleep timer which in my opinion is a drawback. The Bluetooth, WiFi and the fact that it is a lot lighter is a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Gadgetgrannie

customer_reviews.title: Embarrassing design fault
customer_reviews.text: There's a huge and quite terrible design fault with this machine. The OFF swith protrudes from the bottom of the unit. Prop it up for a comfortable reading angle and what happens? Yes, it switches itself off! Very funny at first, and then extremely annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Pippington

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly Bad
customer_reviews.text: Really really bad.The design is just flawed to start with!The power button sits at the bottom of the kindle so if you hold it it switches off. As for the working of the kindle it’s shocking, flashing and slow.Combine that with a touch screen which is ignorant to touches to the point of having to almost break the screen. And battery life?Awful!!!Ive managed to have mine last for 4 days max....4 days!!!?!!!! I feel I’ve been really ripped off with this product, amazon have done a shocking job.
customer_reviews.author: Storry's

customer_reviews.title: KINDLE PROBLEMS
customer_reviews.text: 2 Kindle paperwhites delivered, one in French the other in "Chinese" There was no way we could link them to our account. Spent nearly 2 hours on internet trying, Have tried to order two more kindles but they say we have reached our allocation level? Whats that all about? We want two kindle paperwhites in English at the special offer price!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Gloria chittenden

customer_reviews.title: £30 off just 2 weeks after release? What a way to penalise those who preorder!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it as it is waterproof. Had to replace two previous Kindles because of water damage! The new styling with a flush screen makes it much easier to keep clean. Obviously not designed by avid readers if you try and prop it up on a shelf to read whilst you are doing something else the power button is depressed and it switches off. Giving one star as buying a Kindle is really buying a service especially if you pay for Kindle Unlimited so reducing the price by £30 two weeks after release is a slap in the face.
customer_reviews.author: Calde

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: It's nice to have the extra storage and being able to play Audible books but no earphone jack, now have to buy Bluetooth. Biggest gripe Special offers and Ads can't turn them off unless you pay £10. I didn't ask to subscribe to this, haven't got it on my other Kindle. Think it's a liberty. Thinking about closing my account. Disgruntled!
customer_reviews.author: R E Osborn

customer_reviews.title: Item was faulty
customer_reviews.text: My new Kindle Paperwhite was not filling up, so i had to recharge every day even when i did not use the kindle. Plus Paperwhite is much slower than my current Kindle Voyage.
customer_reviews.author: Noura

customer_reviews.title: Great kindle! Love that it’s waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED TO 5** - After Amazon sent me a new one due to battery fault and new one works great!!! Battery is lasting! I had the original kindle paperwhite from 2012 and decided to upgrade! Now all is great with the new kindle! Love the waterproof and audio feature and alot quicker then my old one! But overall great product! Happy I upgraded :D
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Getting your library of books (3000 in my case) onto the device is laborious and riddled with errors
customer_reviews.text: The product fails on 2 major counts: 1.Too many kindle bought books are shown as incompatible with the new device and will not download. No converter provided. Just will not download. 2.The download of your library (mine has 3000 + books) has to be done with each book 1 by 1 because the Amazon software does not scale. Several others have the same issue, Go to 'Manage content and devices' and try to download your library using the technique provided. Good luck if you have a large library. everything works apart from any download actually happening and I have a 1 Gb/s Hyperoptic service.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Excellent update to new kindle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kindle as I had lost my previous one on holiday. I think this is a great updated version of the paperwhite kindle. It is very lightweight, streamlined and has a high quality feel to it. No shadowing or unevenness noted on my screen and I can completely immerse myself in my book with no distractions. It has the added bonus of being waterproof and I can access the audible versions of my books if wanted. I love this kindle.
customer_reviews.author: AMAT

customer_reviews.title: So light and thin
customer_reviews.text: This is so light and thin in comparison to my previous Paperwhite. Not had an oppur tunity to test the waterproof side as yet but I expect that not to be an problem either.
customer_reviews.author: S. Brown

customer_reviews.title: A brilliant buy.
customer_reviews.text: Neat and slim. Very lightweight. Good instructions and very easy to read. Fits neatly into handbag and does everything it said it does . A good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Falconer

customer_reviews.title: Not fit for purpose
customer_reviews.text: Poor support for WPS and long WIFI passwords make this model not fit for purpose in 2018. A huge step backwards comparing to my previous Kindle (model 2012) which would connect to my home WIFI without any issues. Hopefully at some point in the future Amazon will release an upgrade to its firmware (how will I download it without compromising my network security is another question). Until then - not recommended to anyone who doesn't think that "password123" makes for good cyber security.
customer_reviews.author: Raf

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery life
customer_reviews.text: I charged this device fully when I received it. Turned it off until I was ready to transfer my books over. The battery lasted one day. By the time I switched it on again it was flat. I recharged it and could almost see the battery life draining from it. Will stick with my more reliable version.
customer_reviews.author: Book Worm

customer_reviews.title: Superior text quality on old model
customer_reviews.text: You can clearly see from the photos that the blacks aren't as black on the new model (right) The text doesn't appear as distinct against the background making it harder to read. The page colour is a colder, whiter tone which is less appealing to the eye and less like a real book. There is a lot more glare off the new model as it has a smoother, more reflective surface. It also destroys the somewhat grainy feel of the older model which mimiced real paper. Text quality should be the first priority in developing new READING devices. They should rename this the 'Kindle butter fingers BATH model' to stop 99% of readers wasting money on a new, inferior device.
customer_reviews.author: JHo

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Having had 2 other Kindles my expectations were high but they were dashed when it arrived. My last Kindles was an all singing all dancing device that enabled games and access to the internet, so expected the new one to have this & it didn’t
customer_reviews.author: Karoline

customer_reviews.title: storage misleading
customer_reviews.text: it states 8 GB but once you switch it on and connect to wifi you can see on Device Info free space is only 6 GB Disappointing
customer_reviews.author: bahram pourkomailian

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this updated Kindle Paperwhite mainly because it is waterproof. Safe to use at the beach, swimming pool or bath without having to worry about water accidently falling on it. Is a bit smaller than the other Kindle Paperwhites though the screen size is the same. It's lighter and thinner. Has built-in adjustable light so can read indoors and outdoors any time of day or night. Has anti-glare. Arrived very quickly. It is good quality.
customer_reviews.author: mal

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Have always had a kindle until it finally died. Bought this new one and so far i'm not impressed. struggling to download from my cloud even though it says i have a good connection. Item is very sluggish. Swipe or press the screen and it takes a good few seconds to respond. You end up swiping again and then it jumps multiple pages. Currently I would have to say its not worth the money, even at the sale price.
customer_reviews.author: Ciac13

customer_reviews.title: Easy readable
customer_reviews.text: I find it very compact after my old one.which I like. I am now getting used to having a touch screen.being 86yrs old it will take a bit longer to get use to it. I think the white screen is a lot better for me to see at night.
customer_reviews.author: marguerite bennett

customer_reviews.title: Takes time downloading your books from your d kindle
customer_reviews.text: It did take a long time to download all my books and I had trouble finding my collections but now that is all done I am really enjoying it. It is very light and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs D Nastri

customer_reviews.title: I think im getting a kobo
customer_reviews.text: I had to return the first device as it had a fault. I'm not impressed with the second either. When downloading books it is very slow. When downloading my documents it will download then remove the download. This is really frustrating when you have spent a long time downloading. It wont even accept books or documents sent from approved email addresses. The device is light and easy to hold and the battery life is very good. Having shelled out for the 32 gb version I am a very unhappy kindle paperwhite 5th gen owner. The practicalities of the device dont match the hype I'm afraid.
customer_reviews.author: AVID READER

customer_reviews.title: I love this.
customer_reviews.text: I had a couple of hiccups at first. Contacted Amazon and they then rang back a couple of times to sort this out. Now all done with no problems and i love it. It is almost the same as my previous paperwhite but has more functions, which i probably won't use much. It's light, waterproof(which i haven't used yet) and meets all expectations. I bought this because my other kindle just wouldn't hold any charge so i gave up and now i am very pleased with this one. Amazon staff were brilliant in sorting out initial problems and kept in touch every step of the way.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: A bit dissappointing !
customer_reviews.text: The print quality is ok. Instructions are pathetic or more accurately non existent. I have Bose wired noise cancelling headphones which cannot be used because there is no wired earphone connection. Not much use then when on a plane in aeroplane mode with bluetooth switched off. I downloaded a user manual from kindle which was far from comprehendible. Manouevering your way through menus etc is almost impossible. If you only want to download and read an ebook it is probably ok
customer_reviews.author: D. hickson

customer_reviews.title: Big fan of the Paperwhite
customer_reviews.text: I have three Kindle Paperwhite devices, one in the lounge, one in the car and one in the bedroom. I look forward to using the increased capacity. I currently have around 600 books in my library. I love my Kindle s and would be lost without them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Alex

customer_reviews.title: great to use .
customer_reviews.text: love it .but feeling mad as only got it on the 12th .and now its 30 pound cheaper .would have waited .if i had known .as being a oap .that would have paid for a case for it .but love being able to read in bed .with out a bedside light on .
customer_reviews.author: lorna doon

customer_reviews.title: Too sensitive
customer_reviews.text: As much as i tried to love this all new paper white kindle it saddens me to say that I have to returned this device. Being touchscreen and very small on the edges I have not been able to read without all sorts of functions popping up or changing pages. No matter how carefully I handle the device. It would be alright for sitting down reading on a table or flat in the hand but I always read before sleep and need to be able a one hand hold . Will upgrade to the oasis ones the refund is completed.
customer_reviews.author: tineke

customer_reviews.title: Great new kindle
customer_reviews.text: Love this new kindle and also the new cover I bought to fit it, it is slimmer than my old one really comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Very light and clear
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes I find it hard to navigate to different books. I did like the original kindle for navigation. I do like the screen it is very clear and also lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Philippa Purcell

customer_reviews.title: Be aware. Wrong USB cable provided
customer_reviews.text: The USB cable provided does not fit so can’t charge the Kindle .... and this has already been a reported problem so why is it still being shipped with wrong cable!!! This was a Birthday present, so extremely disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: Another Liz

customer_reviews.title: A big fat dud
customer_reviews.text: No stars for this, the battery wouldn’t stay charged, I corresponded with amazon, they gave me some advice, which I followed. This started it working for a few weeks, just enough time so I couldn’t return it. Now it’s completely gone. It has 60% battery charge, but just keeps going round in circles, see attached photos. I have no idea how to get a replacement as there is nothing on the website to allow me access. I hope someone sees this and helps me, or I’ve just wasted £90
customer_reviews.author: Gracymac

customer_reviews.title: Smooth
customer_reviews.text: I bought the new Paperwhite because I wanted more storage and 4g connectivity when travelling, The ability to listen to audio books via Bluetooth headphones is a bonus. The new version is just a little bit smaller and lighter than the original. It also feels smoother to the touch. The kindle logo is more prominent. Listening to audio gives an immersive listening experience similar to the Kindle reading experience. It is compatible with my original pre-Paperwhite Kindle cable and charger. (Just as well given that the USB cable supplied did not fit). Battery life seems considerably shorter than that of my earlier Paperwhite, and a matter of days not weeks, though charging is quick.
customer_reviews.author: Chattahoochee Tern

customer_reviews.title: A previously great product made poor
customer_reviews.text: I got my first Paperwhite in 2013 but it could no longer hold power. I regret buying this one. It does not seem possible to get it to show collections AND single books, it is impossible to get it download the books and what is worse, it no longer downloads the covers of the books. Interestingly, my old barely functioning Kindle has no problems with this. I originally bought the version of the Paperwhite with offers, but eventually paid the extra money to get rid of the offers, however, despite being logged in on WiFi and asking it to update, the offers and advertisements. Overall, I would not recommend this Kindle to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I have owned four Kindle paperwhites now. This latest device has given me the worst experience. The edges of the touchscreen are far too sensitive, so that I get unexpected page turns that are extremely frustrating. The last two of three times I have used the device, the touchscreen has started behaving completely erratically, not responding to my actual presses and, even when left alone, randomly changing the zoom, turning pages and highlighting text. Garbage. UPDATE: I got the kindle replaced, and four months later, I have the exact same problem. The touchscreen has a ghost and randomly presses, so much that I cannot even do basic navigation. Utter garbage.
customer_reviews.author: philscotted

customer_reviews.title: Terrible, disappointing customer service
customer_reviews.text: It has been a week and a half. I have yet to receive a defect-free, clean Paperwhite in brand new working condition. I am a Prime member. This is absolutely ridiculous and makes me lose faith in Amazon's customer service training. I have spent hours speaking to customer service agents on the phone and over chat, each rudely referring me to a new department without asking for permission to do so. I am generally a hugely patient person but this is really testing the limits. Amazon, this needs to be fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as my original Kindle was failing after a great many years of use. The new Kindle is a dream, very clear screen with adjustable brightness and what I liked, was already linked to my Amazon account.
customer_reviews.author: Tony M

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Bought this as a gift for my dad's 60th going on a round the world trip, he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: John McLuckie

customer_reviews.title: Totally disgusted with Amazon
customer_reviews.text: we bought this Item as a new product , a new updated super Kindle in good faith. delivered as new realise 7th november £120 .two weeks later this new super product £89 ?????? Totally disgusted with amazon , no way to treat long standing customer.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Davison

customer_reviews.title: Small, neat and perfect to read all your books with.
customer_reviews.text: Love my new kindle. My other one gave up the ghost and as l read constantly needed a new one straight away. I can't sleep without reading first as it helps me relax. Tried reading with my iPad until my new kindle arrived and on the first night started to drop off to sleep and the iPad fell and the corner stabbed me in the eye. Still having trouble with my eye but am having to wait until after this crisis before getting something done about it. Now l just need to get a cover for it but l don't want a plain one. Hopefully new ones will be around soon. Recommend Kindle highly 1000%++++
customer_reviews.author: Sasco

customer_reviews.title: 8gb storage is actually 6.25gb storage
customer_reviews.text: I decided to buy the new kindle. When starting to download book, i then realise that you get only 6.25gb of storage. I thought this is kind of false advertising. Also, if you want to remove add you have to pay addition 10 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: Much better battery life.
customer_reviews.text: Finally, a kindle that will last all week without charging. The new improved paper white is a pleasure to use, with smooth touchscreen features, a pleasant light and a battery that keeps going giving the confidence to take the kindle out and about. The battery life is improved with an automatic sleep function, meaning that it takes a little longer for the kindle to come to life when opened ( I use a cover for mine so it still retains the feeling of opening a book.) All in all, a worthwhile purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: All new Kindle Paperwhite
customer_reviews.text: I bought the paperwhite to replace my old kindle which gave up the ghost. I liked the fact that it is smaller and lighter but with the same screen size. also the backlight, which is adjustable, makes it much easier to read in all lighting conditions. The new paperwhite synced to my account seamlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart

customer_reviews.title: The Paperwhite is very slow
customer_reviews.text: This is my 5th Kindle. After the Kindle Fire HDX (3rd Gen), with a quad-core, 2 GB ram and 2.2 GHz speed they have been a disappointment. This Paperwhite is the worse of the lot. In fact each succeeding version of Kindle is a little worse the one before. The paperwhite home page is in black and white while I assumed all apps would be in colour. It is very slow; the home page shows only a limited number of books, I couldn’t find an email facility. Maybe it is an app I would need to download but it should have been part of the set up as is the case with most phones etc.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Amazing upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Kindle Paperwhite Generation 10 as a present for my partner and she absolutely loves it. She was actually more than happy with her Generation 4 Kindle (several years old) and would probably never have bought a new one until that died but now she says she couldn't go back. It's much sleeker than the Gen 4 it's replaced and lighter too. I was concerned that the back light would demolish the battery life quicker but it seems to last for weeks even with the back light on all the time. If you're a Kindle user and have a much older generation then this is a must-have upgrade and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: turnipboy

customer_reviews.title: Very light and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: The screen is perfect for reading in any light. Simple to use. The on off switch is a bit fiddly to work but there is little chance you can turn it off accidentally. It is very responsive to any uploads and I love the feature that asks you if you want to go to the most recent page if you are reading on multiple devices. I would recommend this and everyone should have one.
customer_reviews.author: Janie R

customer_reviews.title: Great for reading outside especially in sunsshie
customer_reviews.text: Great light feature so you can read easily wherever and whatever the weather. It’s got wifi. Comfortable size and weight for holding whist reading. I am pleased with it but think it’s quite pricey as it really doesn’t do much else but let’s you read. My old basic kindle had mulch more functionality but obviously you couldn’t read in sunlight. If other kindle tablets could have the same ability to read in sunlight I would have bought one but for just a reader I think it’s dear but because I read quite a lot I needed the paperwhite function
customer_reviews.author: carol lynne

customer_reviews.title: Works OK so far BUT...
customer_reviews.text: I was reading a free taster which got to a certain point, then you had to buy the book. Which I did as the novel was a good one. But when I tried to pick up where I left off, it wouldnt let me. It was marked as "Read" even though I had only read part of it. I changed this to "Unread" but it still wouldnt let me read on. So I've paid for a kindle edition of a book, only to find I cant read the book I've paid for. this is more a software problem than a hardware one, but I've now paid out good money receiving nothing in return.
customer_reviews.author: grumps

customer_reviews.title: Customer service is terrible. Battery is a scam.
customer_reviews.text: Its so annoying these keep using power even when it’s off. It’s just stuck on the battery screen with an ! mark. Customer service is crap they just ask you to use another charger or hold the power button for 40 seconds. I can’t get an exchange because it’s just over the 1 year warranty. I would have been better off just buying the paperbacks of the books I have stuck on there now. They just tell you to buy a new device there is no way to get it repaired or battery replaced so it’s very wasteful.
customer_reviews.author: sofiya

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I like this updated version. Ive not explored all of it yet but I like the wake up function. It’s much lighter to hold and I like the more seamless, streamlined front. I think the screen could be a little larger because of this though. I’ve not tested the waterproofness yet, a little scared. I am thrilled that the battery life will be a lot longer, I’ll update on this when I’ve had it a while. All in all I’m really pleased I upgraded.
customer_reviews.author: kim

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for occasional users - FAULTY
customer_reviews.text: Had my Kindle paperwhite from December 2018 until January 2020 (13 months). It had light usage and then suddenly stopped charging. Amazon support wouldn't even entertain the idea of helping me out as I was 20 days outside of warranty. The most I was offered was a 15% discount on buying a new one! So, a great device if you use it a lot, but if you're an occasional user and potentially don't charge the device often then be aware that the battery may develop an issue. Google "paperwhite battery" and you should find other customers with similar stories.
customer_reviews.author: Dotnetter

customer_reviews.title: good update
customer_reviews.text: given to me as a gift to replace my original kindle which was beginning to show its age. like the back light means easy to read in an setting. Like that all books are dispalyed although took time to remove, as read, books that previously I had removed from my device having finished the book but not all the extra pages at the back! Good battery life although it takes longer to recharge than my original. light and easy to hold now I have adapted my hold to avoid the on off button. love that it shuts down on closing the cover and quickly restarts on opening it .
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Great clarity but battery lasts less than a week
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded my previous Kindle because my battery was no longer efficient. I was needing to recharge it every 4 or 5 days. I feel that I have wasted my money because this new Kindle Paperwhite needs recharging every five or six days. I was expecting it to last at least a couple of weeks - and possibly 3 or 4 weeks - which was the length of time between charges of my previous Kindle when it was new.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine P.

customer_reviews.title: Avoid at all costs
customer_reviews.text: I would avoid this product. As expensive it is the screen is tacky and the 10 books they offer you for free will all disappear regardless that they state that you can keep them regardless if you subscribe or not. The platform itself is not user friendly and the helpline only repeats that this is what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Cassye

customer_reviews.title: Kindle No3
customer_reviews.text: I ordered my kindle @ 12.30.pm, and received it 6 hours later. So can’t fault the delivery service. The kindle itself.... I am finding it slower to react. To power up is to wake up slowly. Page turning is either too quick or too slow. Maybe it’s just me needing to get use to the the “feel” of the new one. I think the thing that has really pissed me off is.... you have to pay£10 extra to buy a kindle without advertising, or pay £10 to have it taken off !!. That is just so wrong. To end, I am a kindle girl, and never leave home without one!
customer_reviews.author: annie

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Kindle, and I still would not be without one - but I have never experienced the battery life that Amazon state is the normal. I am very lucky if I go a week without having to charge my kindle. That said, this new version is much more responsive than the previous versions. Just a slight pressure on the edge will turn the page, whereas my older Paperwhite I had to push quite hard to get any response out of it. This version is also much slimmer and lighter and supposed to be waterproof, well I don't intend to test that but I will continue to enjoy reading regardless.
customer_reviews.author: IMCPU2

customer_reviews.title: STOPPED WORKING A WEEK AFTER
customer_reviews.text: My partner bought this for me as a birthday present. I was on the plane whilst reading a book when all of a sudden it stopped working. I assumed it run out of battery but wen reached my destination and plugged it back the light only went on and was not warking.Nothing appeared on the screan for me to tap on! such a pity as I looked after it , always have it wrapped in soft cloth as to avoid scratches. Have not returned it yet as I do not know how to returnrd it , because like I said it was bouth as a birthday present 2 weeks ago!
customer_reviews.author: Angelica

customer_reviews.title: An amazing device in every way, well impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I was bought this for a birthday present and absolutely love it. The weight is nothing, easy to grip one handed, which can be an issue with a door stop paperback. Readability in light is like fairy magic, even in direct sun there is barely any glare??!!!!! Battery life is tremendous and I've rarely had to charge it. Great for comics though would advise a colour version if they do one. Also has Bluetooth so you can have your audible books through your beats or whatever BT headset you fancy. This has also got me reading more tbh, as it's always at hand and remembers the page for me lol
customer_reviews.author: C3

customer_reviews.title: Usual superb amazon qualit
customer_reviews.text: I am yet to be disappointed with an Amazon item. The build quality is excellent and the kindle is very user friendly with decent GUI Selection of books is limitless not to mention magazines. Bought for my wife and every hours peace it give me justifies the money spent! Bought during one of the frequent amazon sales. Accessories seem a little overpriced compared to generic versions but those can be sourced on amazon or other retailers without any great effort. Back light and visibility are good in all light and the settings are extremely easy to alter. Would recommend the kindle unlimited. worth the monthly subscription
customer_reviews.author: Adam Steele

customer_reviews.title: Undecided on my new Kindle.
customer_reviews.text: After my first Kindle started to freeze up after 8 years, I bought this new one. The best bit is the light so that you can read at night without having a lamp on. However I am having trouble with collections. On my old Kindle, once you moved a book to the collection it disappeared from the list but every time I move a book to the collection, it also stays in the list. This seems pointless and leaves the library looking messy. I am still not sure what to do.
customer_reviews.author: John Mcdonald

customer_reviews.title: Good model, great value and a definite improvement
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the latest version for my wife who has a 4th generation kindle. Impressed with the lighter weight and the benefits of the screen especially when reading in bed. Was very easy to set up and get started as well as transfer books from her old device. The waterproofing feature is really a bonus but you never know it’s usefulness as accidents can happen anytime and this feature offers a little more reassurance. I would recommend this product and if you have never had a paper white before you would not go back to another device.
customer_reviews.author: G Hill

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the 2nd generation Kindle
customer_reviews.text: Bought this when I broke my 2nd generation Kindle. It is light and clear to read. Small and easy to carry. I have given it four starts and not five for two reasons. First, you have to buy the plug separately and I think it should be included. Secondly the term ‘special offers’ is misleading. It looks like you are getting a discount if you buy the plug and cover when in fact it means you get adverts for books on the screen when you open the Kindle. I have to Google to find out what ‘special offers’ meant. It should be clearly described in the product description. I’m a big fan of Kindles and this one is great!
customer_reviews.author: David Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Such a good upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from the previous paperwhite to this and I love it! I love audio books at the moment and having the option to play them from where I left off in the book is amazing. Now that amazon sells the audiobooks along side of the ebook for a discounted price I feel this would benefit me even more.
customer_reviews.author: Kerrie Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Updated but not all good
customer_reviews.text: Not all improvements era a benefit. Certainly the back light is,that’s why I upgraded but I don’t like the swipe page changer at all. I find it so annoying,my very old kindle had side buttons which for arthritic fingers are so much easier to navigate instead of swishing around Also am at a loss as to how to save books on cloud and how to retrieve for the future to free up storage Love the audio settings a great addition
customer_reviews.author: Pol

customer_reviews.title: Great improvement on my 8 year old Kindle.
customer_reviews.text: I still prefer proper bound books - and it works out cheaper if you buy disposables from Amazon. Neverthless there are times when a Kindle is great - goinig away for a period of time, for example. So I like to have one but don't use it all the time. I bought this one to be able to read the latest Game of Thrones book - which is simply massive in hardback. I bought one with 'special offers' but they annoyed me so much I paid the extra £10 to have them removed. They were never showing me books I was at all interested in (I thought they were personalised!).
customer_reviews.author: Skypilot

customer_reviews.title: Perfect reading in any lighting!
customer_reviews.text: I love the size of my new kindle compared to my old fire; it’s lightweight and fits into my hand easily. You can choose the font size to suit your requirements which is a great feature. The light is perfect to read of a night and I also read it with no problems in direct sunlight. A feature I don’t like is the power switch being located at the bottom; I use a stand when I’m reading and I have to keep lifting it out if I need to switch it back on again. I read in the bath anyway so I feel safer the fact it is waterproof!
customer_reviews.author: dee

customer_reviews.title: Great, lightweight device!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Kindle & I love it. I bought a case with a hand strap at the back, to just simply slide your hand in to hold the device. It’s very easy to get to grips with. My only gripe would be it’s quite slow (compared to a phone or iPad). So glad I bought one, easy to carry around, lightweight & love the fact it tells you at the bottom on the page, how many more minutes of reading are left until the end of the chapter, which I found really helpful when reading late at night.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Worthwhile update
customer_reviews.text: Had to buy a new Kindle after my old Touch was dropped and stopped working. Delivery was quick and easy. On arrival I plugged it in (old charger works well) after a few minutes charging it asked for network connection and quickly found router and connected; then asked for Amazon Account and started downloading my library instantly. In use it’s lighter and brighter than the old Touch, font is definitely clearer and easier to read. The cover works well putting it to sleep when closed and auto-starting when opened. Great. I am fairly specific on what I read so bought “without special features” as I cannot stand un-solicited advertising. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Hampshire_Birdman

customer_reviews.title: Not much good
customer_reviews.text: I bought a new kindle paperwhite beginning of June this was my fourth kindle. I sent it back because it kept turning itself off. Amazon did replace the problem was trying to print off the returns label. That has still not been resolved. The new kindle paperwhite this is now my fifth kindle paperwhite . This new kindle has developed the same problem it turns itself off while I am reading it and sometimes it won’t turn on, you have to reboot it. I would say this is the worst kindle I have bought. Please think seriously before buying
customer_reviews.author: Gillian Heard

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but...
customer_reviews.text: Compact, light and comfortable to hold and read. But... touch screen very slow; organising books very difficult - unlike my previous Kindle Keyboard the Paperwhite is a large backward leap. I have always had a Read Books Collection so read books are removed from the Home screen on the Keyboard. But on the Paperwhite the Home screen shows all books. If the Home screen would show ONLY the books that are NOT in any other Collections it would be so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use on dark evenings!
customer_reviews.text: I liked the size and the light of the kindle. I am not so keen on the touch screen- difficult to identify correct areas to turn page. A grid would help ? Choice of books seems limited/repetitive, mainly fiction. I have ended up reading fiction /drama that I would not normally choose. On/off button difficult to see and a bit small to operate. The process for ordering books seems a little unclear,although I am sure I will become more proficient! I intend to persevere and hope my experience will be worthwhile.
customer_reviews.author: Peter T.

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous and better than the normal kindle by far
customer_reviews.text: So much better and worth the extra money over the normal kindle. I was sceptical about the light setting but it is really good. The dark mode is also better for my eyes. The best thing about this however, is that I can lock the font settings which have driven me crazy for 6 years with my other 2 normal kindles I have had. Hooray!! The bonus is that it is water resistant and as I am very clumsy it is a good idea. Extremely happy and reading again for hours with no issues. Battery power is no problem as long as wifi is off and I'm not using audible, which I dont.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Unnecessary advertising
customer_reviews.text: I love the paper white kindle. I purchased this as I dropped and damaged my original. I have only one problem with it, and that is that when I open the case it no longer goes straight into the book I’m reading! First the screen displays an advertisement, then it says Waking up, then another advert and then the instructions to ‘swipe up’ to ‘Unlock’ the it will open your book!! In my opinion it is too much faffing about in comparison to the early addition paper white. It actually irritates me that I can’t just open and read!! I guess I will get used to it but I don’t want anymore adverts in my life.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Everitt

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a new Paperwhite as an upgrade to an old one I had. Really love it! Much like my old one in look and weight, however, my old one was a bit glitchy and would have a longer touch-screen reaction time, and the battery was going. The power wouldn't last very long. This one has: - Smoother screen texture. - I have the option to change the screen to black background/white font for when I read in bed - Quicker response time (although that could be because mine was old) - Longer battery life Haven't used the Whispersync feature yet but definitely something I would use.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Konvert

customer_reviews.title: Not Able to Read and Listen to Audible at the Same Time
customer_reviews.text: Really like this. Lost a star as I bought it for one specific reason. And that was so that I could have audio books and reading books on the same device. My expectation was that I could listen to the audio book while reading it as well. As someone who struggles with dyslexia I really benefit from listening and reading at the same time in order to digest the information. If anyone from the Kindle team sees this could implementing a audible overlay to my books be considered for a future software update. It would be a game changer for people like me who struggle with reading!!!
customer_reviews.author: Charles Bonner

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for hidden special offers.
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Works well. Costs effective way to purchase books. However, watch out for the special offers small print which leads to you getting advertisements on a piece of tech already costing over 100 pounds. I bought from Argos and it clearly wasn't advertised. I Have discussed with Amazon who said there is nothing they can do to get rid of them. Poor service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to replace my old one which finally died on me after many years of constant use. This new one is sleek and easy to use. Having read the reviews I was a little reluctant as people said it is easy to turn itself off and turn over too many pages at once. All this is true but you just need to persevere and get used to the extra sensitivity of the touch screen and hold it so you are not pressing on the on/off button. I am still delighted with my new purchase after 6 months continuous use, I paid the extra ten pound so I didn't get annoying ads. Well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Avid romance fan

customer_reviews.title: small and slim
customer_reviews.text: I love books, so this kindle is my 4th one, 6'', 10th generation, 8GB (1MB) with a capacity of about 3000-6000 books. It is a paper white bought it in bundle together with cover and special fast charger including its own cable. It is also slim, the cover matches perfectly its size, the text is very clear. Immediately after setting it up, all my library from the old kindle has been transferred on it so, in short time the new kindle was ready to be used. The price is quite affordable as it will be paid in instalments over the following months. All in all, nice purchase.
customer_reviews.author: paula

customer_reviews.title: Died two months after warranty
customer_reviews.text: I loved my Kindle like it was my baby. I paid for Kindle unlimited and bought several books. After having it for just over one year it died. I called customer service and they were rude and wouldn't answer my questions. Finally I was offered a small percentage off a new one and they told me to complain on a review and maybe Amazon will help me. I cannot believe the poor customer service. After nothing but good service from Amazon for years, they can't even replace my still new device. I am very disappointed in Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Kory Stout

customer_reviews.title: so easy to use
customer_reviews.text: My old Kindle which i have had for many years was acting up, needing to have a "hard reboot" twice so I decided to treat myself to a new one and keep the other as back-up (should I forget to charge the new one at some stage). What a difference, no more silly buttons on the side which I used to manage to knock frequently, nice simple touch screen. I do still have a bit of an issue finding the books that I transferred over, but I think that is me rather than the Kindle. The back light is brilliant, means I can finally read in bed comfortably. Very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: B H SLACK
